common_issues.title: Pieces OS Installation and Startup Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS installation, startup, and integration with local LLMs like Ollama. Problems include installation failures, cloud service connectivity errors, and application launch errors. Solutions involve verifying internet connection, checking for multiple installations, ensuring hardware compatibility with local LLMs, and engaging Pieces support for debugging and log analysis.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

### Key Points:

* User @rohanrathi99 reported difficulties with PiecesOS, facing issues both with cloud services and local models.
* @mark-at-pieces (Pieces support) requested logs for further investigation.
* User provided logs and followed up for updates.
* @mark-at-pieces reviewed logs and proposed a call to dive deeper into the problem.
* A call was scheduled for further investigation.
* The issue was later identified and resolved:
    * Cloud LLM issue: usage of a personal OpenApi key (resolved by removing the key)
    * Local LLM issue: hardware constraints (resolved by using a smaller local LLM)

### Current Status/Outcome:

The issue has been resolved, with the user confirming their issue as fixed.

related_issues.title: Installing Ollama - Forever
related_issues.text:
Installing Ollama - Forever
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/677e938c-3198-4f1b-af00-b22543704fcc)

I have Ollama installed and this is stuck like this forever. I even tried uninstalling Ollama. Still the same :-(
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

- User (@waseem852) is experiencing issues with Ollama installation on Pieces OS.
- The issue persists after multiple installation attempts via different methods (Pieces, winget, manual).

**Problems Identified:**

- Ollama installation fails regardless of installation method.
- User has tried uninstalling and restarting Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- Brian from Pieces support suggests checking if both Pieces apps were shut down after uninstalling Ollama.
- User confirms that both apps were shut down and even killed through Task Manager.
- Brian recommends a call to debug the issue further.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- User accepts Brian's offer to jump on a call for further debugging.
- Brian requests user's email address to send a meeting invite.

**Overall, the conversation highlights a user's frustration with Ollama installation issues on Pieces OS. While the exact cause remains unclear, Brian from Pieces support actively engages with the user to find a solution.**

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Ensure core Dependencies ... (retry setup)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## Summary of Pieces Desktop Application Support Issue:

**Issue:** User (@MR-AAYU) reported they were unable to boot up the Pieces Desktop application. 

**Key points:** 

* User provided log files upon request.
* The issue was identified as the user having two installations of Pieces for Developers.
* The second installation, from the Microsoft Store, was the cause of the issue. 

**Solutions:** 

* Support team member (@nathan-courtney-pieces) identified the cause of the issue.
* User was instructed to uninstall the Microsoft Store version of the application.

**Outcome:** 

* The user was able to boot up the Pieces Desktop application.

**Additional notes:** 
* The user was also informed that Pieces OS is a separate application and is required for Pieces for Developers to run. 
* The support team provided links to additional resources.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Issues
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces Desktop app and OS, including account linking problems, application launch failures, and shareable link generation errors. Troubleshooting steps involve checking for multiple installations, verifying account details, and waiting for new feature releases. Support teams provide guidance and workarounds.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation "Unable to merge accounts"

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @johnkennyuk is experiencing difficulty merging their GitHub and Google accounts in Pieces.
* The current account linking flow is not straightforward and will be replaced by a new one in mid to late February.

**Problems Identified:**

* The current account linking flow is buggy and not user-friendly.
* There appears to be a minor inconsistency in the capitalization of the user's email addresses, potentially causing the merge issue.
* The new account linking service is not yet ready for production.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A new account linking flow is being developed and will be released in mid to late February.
* The user's GitHub account was reset to allow for another merge attempt.
* The user suggested waiting for the new account linking system to be implemented before attempting another merge.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user is currently waiting for the new account linking system to be released.
* The new account linking system is expected to be available in early/mid March. 

**Additional Notes:**

* The user confirmed that the email addresses for email usage are not case-sensitive.
* The new account linking system will be released in stages.
* The user requested to be one of the first to be staged to try out the new system.

**Overall:**

The user is experiencing difficulty merging their accounts due to bugs in the current system and a minor inconsistency in their email addresses. A new account linking system is being developed and will be released in early/mid March, which should resolve the issue.

common_issues.title: Ollama Integration Issues with Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users report conflicts between Pieces OS and Ollama installations, leading to CUDA errors or installation failures. Solutions involve ensuring correct installation order, managing PATH variables, and using compatible Ollama versions. Pieces OS developers are actively addressing these issues in recent releases.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS conflicting with Installed Ollama Server?
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces OS instance's Ollama server would always give errors regarding various Cuda dll files not being registered or not found, so I then installed Ollama server from its source which works and Pieces OS could also connect too and use, the problem I'm facing now is that Pieces OS on startup seems to keep starting its own Ollama instance rather than using the externally installed Ollama server instance which means I see the Cuda dll errors again.  My workaround is that I must quit Pieces OS completely then start Ollama server from its own shortcut then start Pieces OS??

Any Ideas??
## Ollama Installation Issues on PiecesOS - Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* User (johnkennyuk) experienced installation issues with Ollama on PiecesOS.
* Ollama failed to work correctly with PiecesOS, throwing Cuda errors.
* User tried reinstalling Ollama and PiecesOS but the problem persisted.
* Startup order of Ollama and PiecesOS was suspected to be causing the issue.

**Problems identified:**

* Multiple installations of Ollama caused conflicts.
* Ollama installed via PiecesOS may not have been complete or correct.
* Startup order of Ollama and PiecesOS could be problematic.
* Race condition preventing external Ollama instance detection.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Uninstalling both Ollama and PiecesOS and then reinstalling Ollama first.
* Checking and cleaning PATH environment variables.
* Investigating `ollama` keyword in the PATH.
* Restarting Ollama and PiecesOS.
* Upgrading to version 11.1.2 of PiecesOS, which includes a fix for the race condition.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The user initially resolved the issue through repeated uninstalls and path cleanups, though the cause remains unknown.
* The problem reoccurred after updates.
* The user is looking for a more definitive solution.
* PiecesOS developers are aware of the race condition and have implemented a fix in a recent release.

**Additional notes:**

* User primarily uses winget for installation and updates.
* User's initial query focused on detecting external Ollama instances and preventing PiecesOS from installing its own.

**Overall:**

This conversation highlights the complexity of software interactions and potential conflicts between different installations. While the initial issue seems to be resolved for now, further investigation and potential updates from PiecesOS might be needed for a long-term solution.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

### Key Points:

* User @rohanrathi99 reported difficulties with PiecesOS, facing issues both with cloud services and local models.
* @mark-at-pieces (Pieces support) requested logs for further investigation.
* User provided logs and followed up for updates.
* @mark-at-pieces reviewed logs and proposed a call to dive deeper into the problem.
* A call was scheduled for further investigation.
* The issue was later identified and resolved:
    * Cloud LLM issue: usage of a personal OpenApi key (resolved by removing the key)
    * Local LLM issue: hardware constraints (resolved by using a smaller local LLM)

### Current Status/Outcome:

The issue has been resolved, with the user confirming their issue as fixed.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS and Desktop App Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS or Desktop App failing to launch, often after updates. This might involve error messages about cloud services, local LLMs, or dependencies. Solutions include checking for multiple installations, ensuring PiecesOS is running before the Desktop App, verifying internet connection, and using smaller local LLMs on limited hardware.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Key Points Raised

- ThemePark is experiencing an issue where Pieces Desktop fails to launch on Startup.
- The issue seems to be related to a timing conflict between PiecesOS updates and Desktop App launch.
- ThemePark has confirmed that PiecesOS is the app configured to launch on Startup.
- ThemePark has also provided information about a crash in Pieces for VS Code that is related to PiecesOS not running.

## Problems Identified

- Pieces Desktop is not launching on Startup.
- There is a timing conflict between PiecesOS updates and Desktop App launch.
- Pieces for VS Code crashes when PiecesOS is not running.

## Solutions Proposed/Implemented

- Mack-at-pieces suggested that ThemePark confirm which app is configured to launch on Startup (Pieces Desktop or PiecesOS).
- ThemePark confirmed that PiecesOS is configured to launch on Startup.
- Based on this information, Mack-at-pieces suspects a timing conflict between PiecesOS updates and Desktop App launch.
- Mack-at-pieces asked ThemePark to switch the startup app to Pieces Desktop instead.

## Current Status/Outcome

- ThemePark has not yet confirmed whether they have switched the startup app to Pieces Desktop.
- The issue with Pieces for VS Code crashing is still ongoing.

## Other Notes

- ThemePark is using Windows 10.
- ThemePark has Pieces Suite, OS, and Desktop installed.
- ThemePark is running Pieces for VS Code.

## Next Steps

- ThemePark should confirm whether they have switched the startup app to Pieces Desktop.
- ThemePark should provide more information about the crash in Pieces for VS Code, including any error messages or logs.
- Mack-at-pieces should investigate further and provide additional support to resolve the issue.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App launch and connection issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Desktop App failing to launch or connect to Pieces OS, encountering errors like "Invalid port" or issues with dependency connections. This occurs across Windows and Linux, potentially due to conflicting installations or specific machine configurations. Solutions involve verifying dependencies, reinstalling the app, and checking Pieces OS functionality.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Ensure core Dependencies ... (retry setup)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8b426c73-aebb-4905-857f-bdee4cad2882)
## Summary of Pieces Desktop Application Support Issue:

**Issue:** User (@MR-AAYU) reported they were unable to boot up the Pieces Desktop application. 

**Key points:** 

* User provided log files upon request.
* The issue was identified as the user having two installations of Pieces for Developers.
* The second installation, from the Microsoft Store, was the cause of the issue. 

**Solutions:** 

* Support team member (@nathan-courtney-pieces) identified the cause of the issue.
* User was instructed to uninstall the Microsoft Store version of the application.

**Outcome:** 

* The user was able to boot up the Pieces Desktop application.

**Additional notes:** 
* The user was also informed that Pieces OS is a separate application and is required for Pieces for Developers to run. 
* The support team provided links to additional resources.

related_issues.title: Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.8 2025-02-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers hangs on first run in third step (Verify Dependency Connections) with error message

unable to open Pieces Core Services
formatexception: Invalid port (at character 16)
http://0.0.0.0:null/connect

Pieces OS seems to work fine, for a brief moment I can see its window with information that the service is active on some port. Then window closes - it is impossible to bring it back, but icon in the  system tray is still there.

How can I set proper port value for Pieces for Developer, and what is the default port value?
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Marius reported an issue with the Pieces Desktop App.
* The Pieces team suspects the issue might be related to specific Linux machines.
* The issue has been observed before and remains unresolved.

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces Desktop App is encountering an error.
* The cause of the error is unknown but is suspected to be related to specific Linux machines.
* The issue has occurred before and a solution has not yet been found.

**Proposed Solutions:**

* Marius shared the Desktop App log file for analysis.
* The Pieces team suggested a live video call for troubleshooting.
* However, Marius was unable to join the live session.

**Current Status:**

* The issue is still under investigation.
* The Pieces team is reviewing the log file provided by Marius.

**Outcome:**

* No definitive solution has been identified yet.
* The Pieces team will continue to investigate the issue and contact Marius for further information or assistance.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation mentions similar issues reported through other support avenues.
* The support team provided links to related issues and resources for further reference.

recommendations: **Prioritize Ollama Integration Issues:** Allocate additional resources to investigate and resolve the recurring conflicts between Pieces OS and Ollama installations. Focus on improving installation instructions, clarifying compatibility requirements, and addressing CUDA errors.

**Improve Pieces OS and Desktop App Launch Experience:** Investigate the root causes of launch failures, particularly after updates. Provide clearer error messages to help users troubleshoot common problems, such as dependency issues or incorrect installation order.

**Enhance Account Linking Process:** Address the long-standing issue of account linking problems with Google and GitHub. Simplify the account linking flow and ensure users can seamlessly connect multiple accounts.

**Proactive Communication on Known Issues:**  Maintain a visible and updated knowledge base or FAQ section addressing common issues like those with Ollama integration and application launch. This will empower users to self-serve solutions and reduce support ticket volume.

**Gather Detailed System Information:**  During support interactions, prioritize collecting comprehensive system information (OS version, Pieces OS version, installation method, etc.) to expedite issue diagnosis and resolution.
